Posts.Content: I had a PICC line for the 5 months that I had chemo and I was really glad I did. No needles for blood tests, scans or chemo. You get used to it really quickly and don't reaaly notice its there. It was only the last month I found the dressing really itchy. Weekly flush and dressing change didn't take long. I would recommend it but its all personal preference.  Claire x
Posts.Title: Cannula vs PICC vs Port??

Posts.Content: Ive had my line for the last 5 months and managed to get some smooth covers from the internet. They were great as you could order them by bicep size so they were really comfortable. They also came in lots of colours.
Posts.Title: PICC line - advice please

Posts.Content: Hi Ann Im not a big runner but I am into my fitness working with a trainer every week and taking classes. I managed to continue with 3 sessions a week during my chemo but as my sessions went on I definately felt more tired and couldn't do what I could do before so we had to adapt our sessions.  I opted for running on the treadmill instead of outside as I was worried that I would get tired and not be able to make it back. For me, doing something was better than doing nothing and kept me mentally strong. Finished chemo about 4 weeks ago now and I am starting to get my fitness back which is exciting. Just listen to your body and see how you feel x
Posts.Title: Any runners here?
